Star Wars.question: This furry co-pilot of the Millennium Falcon is from the planet Kashyyyk.
This Jedi Master trained both Obi-Wan Kenobi and Luke Skywalker.
This desert planet is home to both Anakin and Luke Skywalker.
This smuggler famously made the Kessel Run in less than 12 parsecs.
The name of the deadly space station that Princess Leia calls 'the ultimate weapon of destruction'.

Egypt.question: This structure at Giza is the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
This river's annual flooding was essential to ancient Egyptian agriculture.
This famous queen of Egypt was the last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom.
This creature with a human head and lion body guards the pyramids at Giza.
This ancient Egyptian writing system used pictures and symbols.

Broadway.question: This musical features songs like 'Memory' and is based on T.S. Eliot's poems.
This hip-hop musical about a founding father premiered in 2015.
This long-running musical features a chandelier that crashes to the stage.
The musical 'Wicked' tells the untold story of the witches from this land.

Railroads.question: This transcontinental railroad was completed in 1869 at Promontory Summit, Utah.
This fictional train from children's literature has the number 5972.
This luxury train service ran from Paris to Istanbul and was famous for its opulence.
This railroad's construction was the largest private sector project in U.S. history when completed in 1855.
This train speed record was set by Japan's L0 Series maglev train in 2015, reaching 603 km/h.

Castles of the World.question: This famous Bavarian castle inspired Disney's Sleeping Beauty Castle.
This London castle has served as a royal residence, prison, treasury, and home of the Crown Jewels.
This Japanese castle is nicknamed the 'White Heron Castle' due to its appearance.
This Czech castle is the largest ancient castle in the world according to Guinness World Records.
This Loire Valley castle spans the River Cher and was used as a German ammunition dump during WWII.

The Wild West.question: This famous gunfight took place at the O.K. Corral in Tombstone, Arizona in 1881.
This outlaw leader of the Wild Bunch was known as the 'Sundance Kid'.
This law enforcement agency was formed in 1823 and is known for their white 'lone star' badge.
